item.title: Spindle Repair Saves Over $20,000
item.description: See how expert spindle repair helped a customer avoid more than $20,000 in replacement costs. A closer look at precision lathe work and practical engineering solutions in action—could repair be the smarter option?

media:content.media:title: Spindle Repair Saves Over $20,000
media:content.media:description: See how expert spindle repair helped a customer avoid more than $20,000 in replacement costs. A closer look at precision lathe work and practical engineering solutions in action—could repair be the smarter option?

item.title: Restoring a Worn Track Rod to Like New
item.description: Watch the step-by-step process of machining and restoring a worn track rod, bringing precision and performance back to the component. A satisfying look at hands-on engineering in action—ready to see how it’s done?

media:content.media:title: Restoring a Worn Track Rod to Like New
media:content.media:description: Watch the step-by-step process of machining and restoring a worn track rod, bringing precision and performance back to the component. A satisfying look at hands-on engineering in action—ready to see how it’s done?

item.title: Shop Skills That Actually Earn You Points at Home
item.description: A light‑hearted moment from the workshop where the sparks fly, the metal smooths out, and—surprisingly—the missus gives her stamp of approval. Just good fun, clean grinding, and a bit of workshoprizz to keep the day interesting.

media:content.media:title: Shop Skills That Actually Earn You Points at Home
media:content.media:description: A light‑hearted moment from the workshop where the sparks fly, the metal smooths out, and—surprisingly—the missus gives her stamp of approval. Just good fun, clean grinding, and a bit of workshoprizz to keep the day interesting.

item.title: Sometimes the Old Tricks Still Work Best
item.description: When liquid nitrogen wasn’t an option, we turned to the classic approach: heat it, hope it expands, and make it happen. A solid blast of oxy gave the bearing mount just enough expansion to free that interference fit.

media:content.media:title: Sometimes the Old Tricks Still Work Best
media:content.media:description: When liquid nitrogen wasn’t an option, we turned to the classic approach: heat it, hope it expands, and make it happen. A solid blast of oxy gave the bearing mount just enough expansion to free that interference fit.

item.title: Heavy Sparks for Heavy Work
item.description: We broke out the carbon arc gouger to remove the excess metal from the front end of the Franna, and it did not disappoint. Big sparks, big noise, and big progress

media:content.media:title: Heavy Sparks for Heavy Work
media:content.media:description: We broke out the carbon arc gouger to remove the excess metal from the front end of the Franna, and it did not disappoint. Big sparks, big noise, and big progress

item.title: Final Drive Hub Repair for a CAT D10 Dozer!
item.description: The team restores a worn final drive hub from a CAT D10 dozer, machining and rebuilding critical surfaces to ensure proper fit and long-term durability.

media:content.media:title: Final Drive Hub Repair for a CAT D10 Dozer!
media:content.media:description: The team restores a worn final drive hub from a CAT D10 dozer, machining and rebuilding critical surfaces to ensure proper fit and long-term durability.

item.title: Machining threads for a cylinder rod
item.description: The team machines precise threads onto a cylinder rod, preparing the components carefully before final assembly.

media:content.media:title: Machining threads for a cylinder rod
media:content.media:description: The team machines precise threads onto a cylinder rod, preparing the components carefully before final assembly.

item.title: Using the Radial Arm Drill to Drill and Tap the holes on the Dozer Spindle Part
item.description: The team uses a radial arm drill to accurately drill and tap holes in a dozer spindle part, showcasing precision setup and careful machining technique.

media:content.media:title: Using the Radial Arm Drill to Drill and Tap the holes on the Dozer Spindle Part
media:content.media:description: The team uses a radial arm drill to accurately drill and tap holes in a dozer spindle part, showcasing precision setup and careful machining technique.

item.title: Custom Bearing Puller in The Making
item.description: The team machines and assembles a custom bearing puller, designing a practical shop-made tool to handle heavy-duty removal jobs.

media:content.media:title: Custom Bearing Puller in The Making
media:content.media:description: The team machines and assembles a custom bearing puller, designing a practical shop-made tool to handle heavy-duty removal jobs.

item.title: Upgrades to the Zayer Milling Machine
item.description: he Zayer mill gets a fresh round of improvements to boost accuracy, efficiency, and workflow. This piece highlights the new components, the installation process, and how each upgrade enhances performance in the workshop.

media:content.media:title: Upgrades to the Zayer Milling Machine
media:content.media:description: he Zayer mill gets a fresh round of improvements to boost accuracy, efficiency, and workflow. This piece highlights the new components, the installation process, and how each upgrade enhances performance in the workshop.

item.title: Franna Crane Project — Removing the Cab
item.description: The Franna crane build moves forward as the cab comes off for inspection and repair. This segment follows the lifting process, the prep work, and what comes next in the restoration.

media:content.media:title: Franna Crane Project — Removing the Cab
media:content.media:description: The Franna crane build moves forward as the cab comes off for inspection and repair. This segment follows the lifting process, the prep work, and what comes next in the restoration.

item.title: Saving the Cat D9 Bulldozer Yoke from the Scrapyard
item.description: A worn and damaged D9 yoke arrives on the brink of being discarded. This piece follows the inspection, machining, and repair work needed to bring the component back to life and keep a hardworking bulldozer in service.

media:content.media:title: Saving the Cat D9 Bulldozer Yoke from the Scrapyard
media:content.media:description: A worn and damaged D9 yoke arrives on the brink of being discarded. This piece follows the inspection, machining, and repair work needed to bring the component back to life and keep a hardworking bulldozer in service.
